alert.note: Alert for Henry; Putnam (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Ohio, including the following counties, Henry and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar estimates that between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across the warning area this evening. Runoff from this heavy rainfall will result in continued flooding through the early overnight hours. Additional showers and thunderstorms are expected after 11 PM EDT this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ottawa, Leipsic, Deshler, Kalida, Glandorf, Ottoville, Fort Jennings, West Leipsic, Cloverdale, Belmore, Miller City, Prentiss and Gallup. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
